devMSMs 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Formats long data

    formatLongData.Rd

    Formats long data

    formatLongData(
  home_dir,
  data,
  exposure,
  exposure_time_pts,
  outcome,
  tv_confounders,
  time_var = NA,
  id_var = NA,
  missing = NA,
  factor_confounders = NULL,
  save.out = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    home_dir

    path to home directory

    data

    dataframe in long format

    exposure

    name of exposure variable

    exposure_time_pts

    list of integers at which weights will be created/assessed that correspond to time points when exposure was measured

    outcome

    name of outcome variable with ".timepoint" suffix

    tv_confounders

    list of time-varying confounders with ".timepoint" suffix

    time_var

    (optional) variable name in original dataset demarcating time

    id_var

    (optional) variable name in original dataset demarcating ID

    missing

    (optional) indicator for missing data in original dataset

    factor_confounders

    (optional) list of variable names that are factors (default is numeric)

    save.out

    (optional) TRUE or FALSE indicator to save output and intermediary output locally (default is TRUE)

    Value

    formatted long dataset

    Examples

    test <- data.frame(ID = 1:50,
                   A.1 = rnorm(n = 50),
                   A.2 = rnorm(n = 50),
                   A.3 = rnorm(n = 50),
                   B.1 = rnorm(n = 50),
                   B.2 = rnorm(n = 50),
                   B.3 = rnorm(n = 50),
                   C = rnorm(n = 50),
                   D.3 = rnorm(n = 50))
test[, c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3")] <- lapply(test[, c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3")], as.numeric)

test_long <- stats::reshape(data = test,
                            idvar = "ID", #'list ID variable
                            varying = c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3", "B.1", "B.2", "B.3"),
                            direction = "long")

test_long_format <- formatLongData(data = test_long,
                                   exposure = "A",
                                   exposure_time_pts = c(1, 2, 3),
                                   outcome = "D.3",
                                   tv_confounders = c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3", "B.1", "B.2", "B.3"),
                                   time_var = "time",
                                   id_var = NA,
                                   missing = NA,
                                   factor_confounders = "C",
                                   save.out = FALSE)
#> Table: Summary of A Exposure Information
#> 
#> | WAVE|       mean|        sd|       min|      max|
#> |----:|----------:|---------:|---------:|--------:|
#> |    1|  0.0916316| 1.1073026| -2.279805| 2.493613|
#> |    2| -0.2911299| 0.9481285| -2.668422| 1.587347|
#> |    3|  0.0738718| 1.0769932| -2.528841| 2.381511|
#> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘psych’
